author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> QQ, given no proof of custody-like game, is there something in the 4844 EIP which demands that nodes actually store and donâ€™t immediately prune blobs?

author: bridge-bot
content: <gakonst> Also recall Peter may have mentioned a new txpool w/ an on-disk impl for storing blob txs, was there a doc for that?

author: realbigsean
content: The only thing would be you may have peering issues if you do this. In lighthouse for example we will ban peers that aren't able to serve blobs over rpc in during data availability period
